Hi my name is Shane Ryan. I am researching using NEAT for time series
predi=
ction.

I have been lurking in the group for the past few months. I've got =
a
few questions/suggestions that I'll post as three separate messages. 

I =
am wondering if anyone has tried using a variable mutation rate?
Basically =
if the system determines that overall the fitness rate
change has gone belo=
w a threshold value. Then increase the chance of
new nodes being added and =
increase the range of weight variations
until the fitness begins to improve=
 again. Then lower the system wide
mutation rate back down again once there=
 has been an improvement.

The way I see it when the system begins to stagn=
ate. Instead of
continuing to fine tune the system. Start making some much =
more
radical changes.

Another way to do this might be too increase the num=
ber of species
based of the rate change of fitness. Essentially start with =
many
species then lower the overall number of species and increase their
po=
pulations when you want to fine tune the solutions. But if there
hasn't bee=
n any improvements for a significant amount of time start
increasing the va=
riety of topologies (ie increase the number of
species) until there are som=
e improvements.

I searched the archives but didn't find any topics exactly=
 matching
this. Sorry if it has been discussed ad nauseum. Please point me =
in
the right direction if this topic has been flogged to death!

Thank you,=


Shane Ryan
